SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using processing info
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find the code in the processing table. When a match is found, then also a food translation record is searched for to also include information on weight reduction/increase (translation proportion). Warning: the processing step is deprecated and is currently only maintained for backwards compatibility reasons.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using food translations
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find food translations for the current food (i.e. the ingredients of a composite food). This may result in one or more food codes for ingredients, and the iterative algorithm will proceed with each of the ingredient food codes in turn.

SettingsItem.Name: Total diet study concentration data
SettingsItem.Description: Specifies whether exposure is based on sampling data from total diet studies.

SettingsItem.Name: Use TDS monitoring data
SettingsItem.Description: Specifies whether monitoring data are used in addition to total diet study data.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using TDS food sample compositions
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find the code in the TDS food sample compositions table (idFood), a default translation proportion of 100% is assumed. The iterative algorithm will proceed with a TDS food (column idTDSFood) sample.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using food extrapolations
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find read across codes. If unchecked, read across table is ignored, default is 'Use read across info'. E.g. for pineapple no measurements are found but by specifying that pineapple is converted to FruitMix (with a default proportion of 100%), the TDS sample concentration value of FruitMix will be used for pineapple (as-eaten or as ingredient).

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using market shares
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find subtype codes, e.g. 'xxx$*' in the market shares table.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow market shares not summing to 100%
SettingsItem.Description: Specify whether to rescale market share percentages that do not sum to 100%. If checked, then foods with marketshares not summing to 100% are allowed. If not, then these foods are ignored in the analysis.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion to supertypes
SettingsItem.Description: Try to find supertypes, e.g. 'xxx$yyy' is converted to 'xxx'. If checked, allows for linkage of consumed foods coded at a lower hierarchical level to foods with measured concentrations at a higher hierarchical level e.g. consumed is Apple (code PF$Apple) --> measured is Pome Fruit (code PF). Note: food codes are split on '$'. Measurements of substances on food are available at a less detailed food coding level than consumption data.

SettingsItem.Name: Allow conversion using default processing
SettingsItem.Description: Allow conversion from processed to unprocessed foods. Either by matching to processing types specified as substrings separated using a '-' character or by matching FoodEx2 facet strings (separated by a '#' character) to processing types.

SettingsItem.Name: Substance independent conversion
SettingsItem.Description: Conversion of foods is independent of the substance.
